turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Navajo song ceremonial complex.
turn.1: What is the order of the Navajo song ceremonies?
turn.2: This ceremony involves five steps: molding into Changing Woman, running, hair washing, painting, and the making of the corn cake.
turn.3: What is the significance of the Changing Woman?
turn.4: Changing Woman is a Navajo deity who embodies all of the ideals of a Navajo woman.
turn.6: The girl partaking in the ceremony is molded by her mentor, the Ideal Woman, who is chosen by the family and represents the qualities of Changing Woman and an ideal Navajo woman.
turn.7: What is the role of the Ideal Woman?
turn.8: Ideal woman molds the initiate so that she can represent Changing Woman and all of her ideal qualities.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: During the Kinaalda ceremony, the initiate’s body is thought to be as soft as it was at birth, so it is able to be easily manipulated and molded.
turn.11: What happens to the initiate's body during the ceremony?
turn.12: The child lays on a blanket or sheepskin while her sponsor massages her body, molding it so it can possess not only the physical qualities of Changing Woman, but the psychological qualities as well.
